title: Waistcoat Fronts, 1760–75
medium:
Materials: silk, metal, sequins
Technique: embroidery using coils of gold colored wire and sequins on a plain weave foundation with continuous supplementary metallic wefts in a twill binding
dimensions: H x W (each front): 83 x 25 cm (32 11/16 x 9 13/16 in.)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Two waistcoat fronts of ivory silk with metallic threads. The fronts are embroidered with an all-over pattern of gold sequins; a narrow band of embroidery follows the center front and lower edges, and the pocket area is decorated with embroidered garlands of flowers, all in gold.

tombstone.epitaph:
Waistcoat Fronts, 1760–75.
1760–75. Materials: silk, metal, sequins
Technique: embroidery using coils of gold colored wire and sequins on a plain weave foundation with continuous supplementary metallic wefts in a twill binding. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-54-9-a,b.
